general_feeling: In total it was fine but wearing it during meetings with people was not comfortable because it gave me a feeling of not being able to connect to people (Maybe because I am not used to wearing glasses). also sometimes it gave me headaches ( it is happening with other glasses too).
challenges: When I was wearing them outside, there were some people looking shocked or curious, few people smiling, and some people getting annoyed. specifically in supermarkets or shops people were worried If I am filming them. cause the way that the sensor looks gives people the impression of a video recorder which made me feel a bit uncomfortable because I gave an impression of intruding their private lives. although I clarified for them that it is not recording videos but light intensity.
beh_adapt: I tried to look less into the eyes of people or look down in environments that people were annoyed or uncomfortable (thinking that I am recording them!)
social: curiosity and feedback was mostly from my friends and colleagues. strangers were also curious but suspicious.
improvements: In should definitely be designed in a smaller size. Preferably not on glasses. it can be made like a sensor on a tip of something like headphone's microphone but extended from something back of the neck (which makes it to not move).
